Tolkien-related events that took place in 1926.

content.title: January
content.content: 1 â€“ E.V. Gordon replaces J.R.R. Tolkien in the Chair of English Language at the University of Leeds.

content.title: March
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien's "Philology: General Works" is published in The Year's Work in English Studies.

content.title: April
content.content: 29 - Leonard Fenton, who would voice the Elvenking in the radio play of The Hobbit and Daddy Twofoot in The Lord of the Rings, is born.

content.title: May
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien meets C.S. Lewis, who will have a lasting impact on his works.

content.title: June
content.content: 25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to W.G. Harding.

content.title: September
content.content: 7 - Don Messick, who would voice Balin and the Lord of the Eagles in The Hobbit (1977 film), is born.

content.title: October
content.content: 21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Willard G. Harding.

content.title: December
content.content: 26 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - The Coalbiters is formed, a faculty club who read Old Norse.
Years
1923 1924 1925 1926 1927 1928 1929
